    public class AddNewActivity
extends GeoFireModuleActivity

    AddNewActivity

    When user clicks green location button in the center of screen, this activity pops up. To create a new place, writing a title and a brief description is necessary, but adding a photo is an option. Just like MainActivity, this Activity needs all dependencies. As a result, it extends GeoFireModuleActivity.
    Since:
    2019-01-06
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ali Taghizadeh Gevari

      • save

        void save()
        When user taps save button, first it validates textInputs, if it was ok, then it tries to create a new object of a place and pushes it to Firebase database. Then it waits for 2 secs and after that pushes the location to another node of Firebase database using the exact key of our pushed newPlace object. In this way we have a same key in 2 different nodes about a same place, and as a result, executing queries will become much easier. Then a Rx BehaviorSubject gets subscribed and waits for the task to get finished, and when it receives the pulse, it simply finishes the activity Note: Before finishing the activity, onPause is called and it disposes any disposable.

      • setUpUI

        private void setUpUI()

      • updateMarker

        private io.reactivex.disposables.Disposable updateMarker(android.support.design.widget.TextInputEditText editText)
        When user tries to write a title or a description, this method helps us to collect characters as user is writing, and when he/she stops writing it emits the text. Then using the emitted string, it redraws the marker.
        Returns:
        Two disposables mentioned above which are added to compositeDisposable in onResume().

      • updatePlacePhoto

        private void updatePlacePhoto(android.net.Uri selectedImageUri)
        This method acts just like updating user avatar in MainActivity. The only difference is that here our BehaviorSubject is added to a compositeDisposable and it gets disposed when onPause is called
        Parameters:
        selectedImageUri - This is the URI of the selected photo received from onActivityResult.
